page.title: 03A Fruit Farm In Huntley.
page.content: Mr.Akerman owns 89.06 hectares of land which are covered with different kinds of fruit trees. Here are some names of fruit which he grows; Apples-Discovery,Worcester,Sunset,Spar tan,Egremont,Laxton's Fortune. Plums- Blaisdon and Marjorie Seedling. Blackcurrants- Baldwin and Benlomond. Blackcurrants are now picked by machines.They are picked when matured (end of July)and then stored. Most of the fruit goes to markets in the U.K.,but there are about 50 tons of blackcurrants surplus. When they pick apples they put they put them in a bag which hangs down the front of the picker.18 years ago the wages for a lady was 3 shillings 4 pence for a day's work.Nowadays people are paid more.The fruit trees are pruned after Christmas.
